channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Care homes want more insurance help over virus
item.description: Owners say homes could face closure if they are not given the same protection from claims as the NHS.

item.title: Manic Street Preachers: Crowds in Cardiff for music events
item.description: The decision to shut a walking and cycling route for the events is criticised.

item.title: London arms fair DSEI attended by Welsh government
item.description: Plaid called the event "contemptible" but the Tories said it was right for officials to go.

item.title: Covid cases in Wales drop for fourth day in a row
item.description: Cases in hospitals rise again but there are signs Covid is easing in the community.

item.title: Gleision: Call for inquest into mining disaster 10 years on
item.description: Bereaved families say there has been "no closure" and they feel "cheated" out of an inquest.

item.title: Covid: 45-minute wait warning as school buses face disruption
item.description: One of Wales' largest councils face disruption due to the number of drivers and helpers isolating.

item.title: Tomos Rhys Bunford, 9, crushed by vehicle was 'funny and loving'
item.description: Tomos Rhys Bunford was killed by a vehicle in a field close to his home earlier this month.

item.title: Corwen footballer killed in crash was twice over drink-drive limit
item.description: Friends told an inquest they tried to persuade Joshua Atkin not to drive after drinking.

item.title: Defibrillators: Â£500k to boost access in Wales
item.description: The Welsh government announced the money after a number of deaths during sports matches this summer.

item.title: Cardiff's Bute Park could benefit from Japanese trees after attack
item.description: A gift of cherry trees from Japan could be used to help repair damage to Cardiff's Bute Park.

item.title: Swansea riots: Mayhill residents to speak to review about violence
item.description: Cars were torched, houses attacked and police officers injured in a night of "large scale disorder".

item.title: Wales to star in Michael Sheen-backed homeless football cup
item.description: Two years on from the Homeless World Cup in Cardiff, actor Michael Sheen backs new UK tournament.

item.title: Care home owners fear legal action over Covid could cause bankruptcy
item.description: Care home owners fear homes could face closure without the same protection from claims as the NHS.

item.title: Gleision: 'Guilt of surviving mine disaster with me forever'
item.description: A decade on from the Gleision mine disaster, two men who survived still carry the weight of the tragedy.

item.title: Carers: 'Going to the day centre is our break'
item.description: Carers fear day centres for disabled adults could be closed during a council's review of services.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Eluned Morgan announces booster jab plan
item.description: Eluned Morgan explains the Covid vaccination plans for 12 to 15-year-olds and the over-50s.

item.title: 'There's no emergency service for mental health'
item.description: Mental health specialists say people do not know where to turn, so are calling the police.

item.title: The Snowdonia bogs attracting rare birds back to Wales
item.description: Curlews and golden plovers have returned to marshland after not being seen since the 1990s.

item.title: Hayley Ladd column: A massive campaign for Wales
item.description: In her first BBC Sport column Wales' Hayley Ladd looks ahead to the upcoming World Cup qualifying campaign, which starts at home to Kazakhstan and away in Estonia.

item.title: Rubin Colwill: Cardiff midfielder 'shattered' from emotion of Forest win - Mick McCarthy
item.description: Cardiff City manager Mick McCarthy says Rubin Colwill, who was replaced at half-time in the loss at Coventry, was "shattered" after Sunday's win at Nottingham Forest.

item.title: Swansea City 0-0 Millwall: Swans still seek first home win
item.description: Swansea City are still searching for a first home win in the Championship under boss Russell Martin after being held 0-0 by Millwall.

item.title: Alun Wyn Jones: Wales captain not ready for final playing chapter
item.description: After releasing his autobiography, Wales captain Alun Wyn Jones says he is not quite ready to finish the final chapter of his illustrious playing career.

item.title: Coventry City 1-0 Cardiff City: Viktor Gyokeres sends Sky Blues into play-off places
item.description: Coventry City move into the Championship play-off places as Viktor Gyokeres's goal caps a comfortable win over Cardiff City.

item.title: 'Cartrefi gofal i gau heb gymorth yswiriant Covid'
item.description: Mae rhai yn y sector yn anhapus bod gwyliau cerddorol wedi cael cymorth i dalu am yswiriant, ond nid cartrefi gofal.

item.title: Cerbydau trydan yn 'peryglu bywydau' pobl ddall
item.description: Elusennau'n dweud bod angen tynhau rheolau er mwyn diogelu pobl sydd Ã¢ nam golwg.

item.title: Presenoldeb Llywodraeth Cymru mewn ffair arfau i barhau
item.description: "Digwyddiad dirmygus" medd Plaid Cymru, ond y Ceidwadwyr yn cefnogi presenoldeb y llywodraeth.

item.title: Natalie Jones: "Barod i gwffio dros eraill"
item.description: Yr athrawes Gymraeg sy' eisiau annog pobl o bob cefndir i fynd i'r proffesiwn

item.title: Morgannwg yn cael cweir arall yn erbyn Sir Gaerloyw
item.description: Sir Gaerloyw yn cwblhau buddugoliaeth gyfforddus yn erbyn Morgannwg ar fore'r diwrnod olaf yng Nghaerdydd.
